snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe addressed some of the changes, like encouraging foreign investment and removing regulations, that economists say are needed, but investors seemed disappointed.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe rolls out next phase of his aggressive strategy to kick-start Japan's economy; plans include to encourage foreign investment, nurture innovation and improve regulation; investors still seem disappointed and stocks drop further.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe addressed some of the changes, like encouraging foreign investment and removing regulations, that economists say are needed, but investors seemed disappointed.

headline.main: Abe’s New Steps in Japan Draw Less Enthusiasm
headline.print_headline: Abe’s New Steps in Japan Draw Less Enthusiasm
